messages.content: As an AI assistant, my role is to meticulously analyze criminal justice documents and extract information about law enforcement personnel. The response will contain: 1) The name of a law enforcement personnel. The individual's name must be prefixed with one of the following titles to be in law enforcement: Detective, Sergeant, Lieutenant, Captain, Deputy, Officer, Patrol Officer, Criminalist, Technician, Coroner, or Dr. Please prefix the name with 'Officer Name:  I will derive this data from the following paragraph: RIVERVIEW METROPOLITAN POLICE DEPARTMENT - INCIDENT REPORT  REPORT #: 97331 DATE: 11/20/23 TIME: 14:45 INCIDENT: Vandalism & Assault  INVOLVING DETECTIVES: DETECTIVE S. T. Harper DETECTIVE U. V. Ford DETECTIVE W. X. Greene  SUPERVISORY: Lt. Y. Z. Fitzgerald - OPERATIONS Captain A1. B1. Taylor ASSISTANT CHIEF DEPUTY C1. D1. Wallace  OTHERS INVOLVED: Sgt. E1. F1. Ramirez Sgt. G1. H1. Choi Forensic Expert Jordan  DETAILS: On the afternoon of November 20, Det. S. T. Harper was notified of an incident involving both vandalism and assault at the Riverview Art Gallery. Upon arriving at the scene, it was evident that several art pieces had been damaged.  The gallery's manager, Ms. Elaine Thompson, stated that a disgruntled visitor, later identified as Mr. Samuel Watkins, had an altercation with gallery staff after being asked to leave due to disruptive behavior. Watkins retaliated by damaging three art pieces before assaulting a staff member, Mr. Peter Sanchez.  Forensic Expert Jordan collected fingerprints from the damaged frames. CCTV footage showed Watkins during his violent spree, capturing clear facial features and the attire he wore that day.  Detective Ford interviewed witnesses, while Detective Greene took statements from both the injured staff member and the gallery's management.  EVIDENCE COLLECTED:  CCTV footage from Riverview Art Gallery Fingerprints from vandalized art frames Statements from Ms. Elaine Thompson and Mr. Peter Sanchez A broken bottle, presumably used to damage one of the art pieces Photos of Mr. Sanchez's injuries Transaction records indicating Watkins' purchase at the gallery's caf√©, confirming his presence SUSPECT INFORMATION: Name: Watkins, Samuel Physical Description: Approximately 61, heavyset, bald with a beard, wearing a black jacket and blue jeans on the day of the incident.  Known Addresses: [Redacted for privacy]  STATUS: Investigation Ongoing. Watkins is currently wanted for questioning related to the damages and assault. A warrant for his arrest is being processed. The gallery is currently closed for restoration and to aid the investigation. Riverview Metropolitan Police advises the public to report any sightings of the suspect and to not approach him as he may be volatile.
Identify each individual in the transcript, by name, who are directly referred to as officers, sergeants, lieutenants, captains, detectives, homicide officers, and crime lab personnel.

Officer Name: DETECTIVE S. T. Harper Officer Context: Notified of an incident involving both vandalism and assault at the Riverview Art Gallery. Officer Role: Detective  Officer Name: DETECTIVE U. V. Ford Officer Context: Interviewed witnesses related to the vandalism and assault incident at the Riverview Art Gallery. Officer Role: Detective  Officer Name: DETECTIVE W. X. Greene Officer Context: Took statements from both the injured staff member and the gallery's management regarding the incident. Officer Role: Detective  Officer Name: Lt. Y. Z. Fitzgerald Officer Context: Mentioned in the supervisory context, but specific duties or actions related to this case are not detailed in the report. Officer Role: Lieutenant  Officer Name: Captain A1. B1. Taylor Officer Context: Mentioned in the supervisory context, but specific duties or actions related to this case are not detailed in the report. Officer Role: Captain  Officer Name: ASSISTANT CHIEF DEPUTY C1. D1. Wallace Officer Context: Mentioned in the supervisory context, but specific duties or actions related to this case are not detailed in the report. Officer Role: Assistant Chief Deputy  Officer Name: Sgt. E1. F1. Ramirez Officer Context: Mentioned among the Others Involved but specific duties or actions related to this case are not detailed in the report. Officer Role: Sergeant  Officer Name: Sgt. G1. H1. Choi Officer Context: Mentioned among the Others Involved but specific duties or actions related to this case are not detailed in the report. Officer Role: Sergeant  Officer Name: Forensic Expert Jordan Officer Context: Collected fingerprints from the damaged frames at the Riverview Art Gallery after the incident. Officer Role: Forensic Expert
